website_summaries.verdict: The Lucid bed folds up neatly and stores easily in small spaces. It is easy to assemble, although buyers should note the holes for the wheels may need enlarging.
pros: The Lucid rollaway bed has a memory foam mattress, supported by a helically-suspended poly deck to support the sleeper's weight
The powder-coated frame has locking wheels for safety and comfort
cons: Some users have reported the mattress isn't thick enough
Other users have reported the bed isn't as large as a twin bed, which may be a problem for very tall sleepers

customer_reviews.title: Great bed for guests.
customer_reviews.text: Looks good. Feels good. Takes up hardly any room. Real comfortable to sleep on. My mother in law is coming for a month and she will sleep soundly on this.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I broke my leg two weeks ago and I am restricted to the main floor of my house. Bedrooms are on the second floor. I purchased the cot for a place to sleep for the next six weeks of therapy. It was very easy to assemble. It feels very sturdy for my first time sleeping in it. The mattresses extremely comfortable for a thinner memory foam mattress. I would recommend this cot for anyone trying to accommodate extra people. It doesn't take up much room and provides a good nights sleep.
customer_reviews.author: zimmyman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Stores Easily
customer_reviews.text: This bed is exactly what I was looking for. I wanted a twin size bed that was comfortable, and when it wasn't needed, could store away easily. My Mom visited me for a week, and she loved sleeping on this bed. It has a memory foam mattress, and you can't feel any bars through the bed. After she was gone, the bed easily folded up for storage in the closet. I'm very happy with my purchase and would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This bed is very comfortable and easy to move around
customer_reviews.text: I am 6' 230 lbs. I have been sleeping on this bed for four nights and all I can say is, WOW! This bed is very comfortable and easy to move around. It is much better than any air mattress I have slept on. It is everything it is advertised to be.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very good bed. I bought this for my daughter to sleep in when she came for a visit recently. After looking at several other rollaway beds, I decided to get this one because of the base (No metal or springs that could be felt through the mattress). The only issue I had was with one small (but important) piece of plastic that was broken. It's the piece that keeps the bed 'folded'. Until the replacement for this is received, it is easily secured with a cord. If you are looking for an extra bed for an overnight guest, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Suz617

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: Due to my current living situation needed a bed that fit in a smaller area. This was perfect. It's comfortable and folds up easily. Simple assembly for the legs and wheels (15 minutes at most). Mattress is thicker than average rollaway beds. Twin sheets are fine(if you don't mind slight hangover)
customer_reviews.author: TeeTee

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble just the wheels and a extension bar ...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble just the wheels and a extension bar on both sides that’s it . Very comfortable memory foam mattress with support springs . I’m 5’9” and weight 225lbs slept on this bed for a week visiting my mother, very comfortable bed for guests
customer_reviews.author: jimmie l brown

customer_reviews.title: as they do not sell the mattress separately.
customer_reviews.text: These are great product. We have ended up buying four of them! They're so much better than air up beds. We've spent hundreds on air up beds, and inevitably they always spring a leak. Clearly these cots will not do that. I definitely suggest buying the sheets that are made to fit the cot, it is not a twin size bed. I also suggest purchasing a waterproof cover to put underneath the zip around liner that it comes with (special, cot sized) as they do not sell the mattress separately.
customer_reviews.author: Arwen R Jackson

customer_reviews.title: SO much better than alternative options
customer_reviews.text: SO much better than alternative options. We initially bought a different brand and it didn’t last long as the support bent on the ends after use leaving the middle bar being felt and the cot deemed useless. THIS LUCID COT is more like a trampoline on the bottom - NO BAR! Even if it were to sag, you wouldn’t have that bar hurting. It’s great! I like the cot size to fit in more small spaces than the twin in our smaller home. Great product! I imagine we will buy another one at some point!
customer_reviews.author: Familyof6

customer_reviews.title: The Snoring Solution
customer_reviews.text: I have been spending a lot of time on the couch because the snoring has been getting louder in my room. What a wonderful surprise when I saw this roll a way cot. " It was an easy to set up, I did it myself (a lady over 50) o Attach wheels and supports bars " It rolls very smoothly over the carpet from room to room " There is a strap to lock it in the upright position " Comfortable to sleep on " I used twin sheets, tucked in. It is nice to have a spare bed available!
customer_reviews.author: S Dority

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased with the Lucid Rollaway Bed that I purchased
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the Lucid Rollaway Bed that I purchased. It is very comfortable and folds away easily and is not as bulky as the other rollaway bed I have.
customer_reviews.author: greenhousehob

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for guests!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually really comfortable! It is lightweight, easy to fold open/closed, and has a nice cushy mattress. We bought it for my mom to stay over and help watch our newborn. Serves its purpose perfectly! I'm glad we invested in this one!
customer_reviews.author: RGoody

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this bed months ago and just had the opportunity to sleep on it. Super comfortable!! The actual size of a twin bed. Great memory foam mattress. Easy to get out of and I just had a back injury about 3 weeks ago!! Room enough for me and my 12 pound cat!
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Love this bed!
customer_reviews.text: It is pricey but totally worth every penny. I was sleeping on either the couch or air mattress for months and my back couldnt take it anymore. This bed has been a lifesaver, I sleep well and I love that I van fold and move out of the way. I am short at 5'1 and I have no issues whatsoever. Setting up was relatively easy.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: This bed is COMFORTABLE - no bars to hurt your back
customer_reviews.text: Had a lot of trepidation about sleeping on this, but it exceeded the info from the seller. This bed is COMFORTABLE - no bars to hurt your back, a great height from the floor, and easy to make up. If you need a spare bed, this is the one. Expensive but worth every nickel - if you've ever slept on a cheap cot, you know they can be deadly.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and ease.
customer_reviews.text: We've used this rollaway bed on many occasions for so many of our guests. The mattress is very comfortable and you can sleep well on it. The frame folds up quickly and with ease. Installation of 4 bars were simple and I did it by myself. You don't need two people to put anything together. I love this bed.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Nichole

customer_reviews.title: a good buy for those wanting a roll away bed. foam mattress comfie
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. It is perfect for what I needed it for. I am a 6ft 1 inch tall 220 pound man it it holds me up and I sleep comfortable. It folds up and rolls away very easily. Id recommend it over a blow up mattress because blow up mattresses take time to put up and down and eventually puncture and by the time you spend more money over and over replacing the blow up mattresses you wouldve bought this more comfortable sturdier roll away. I learned the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingGuy

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable to sleep on night after night during the summer.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Cape Cod and even with two air conditioning systems I need to sleep in the living room during the hottest part of the summer. That's where the cot is and I have to say I am very comfortable. I thought my back would end up hurting but it isn't. I love the fact that there were no chemical smells in the mattress. Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: barbara chaney

customer_reviews.title: Lucid Rollaway Guest Bed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a year ago to sleep over at my son's house when I babysit. I do it twice a week and this little bed is awesome. It is lightweight and easy to store away in the closet. The strap that holds it shut works well. Absolutely no complaints. Worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect extra bed.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! We have guests for an extended period of time. We needed an extra bed. It is comfortable. Easy to open and make up. Easy to put away. Love that it rolls when folded up for storage. A great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: So very happy with this bed.
customer_reviews.text: Received my bed today and actuality put it together by myself with no tools needed. I'm totally amazed at the quality of this bed. I'm thinking of sleeping on it tonight just to try it out. It should sit for about 48 hours to let the memory foam expand so will have to wait. It was a great buy for the price. My guests will love to visit me. 😉😉
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Bad combo
customer_reviews.text: My gripe is: it’s sold as a set assuming that they work well together, but they don’t. Being that it is a memory foam mattress it needs vertical and horizontal supports so the bed does not sag- this frame has got no supports, instead it uses fabric with springs on the side to hold up the mattress. What I’ve found is that the middle sinks too much. I wish I used this bed within the Return period because I would have definitely returned it. But it’s too late now unless someone wants to buy this off me ? Otherwise, mattress is comfy and yes this takes up no space. But I would spend more for a better product
customer_reviews.author: Blu Tooth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Even for a heavy weight like myself. I like it very much. Would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Rose chapasko

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. First, the holes for the screws were not aligned so it took some wrestling to get everything put together. My son is visiting for summer break. He's 17, 5'11", and 170 lbs. He slept on it for 2 nights and 2 of the springs have ripped from the bed! I tried to see if I could reattach them and there's not even a way to do so. Now we're stuck with a brand new broken down rollaway bed. Delivered & assembled: 06/06/2020 Son arrived: 06/08/2020 Broken springs: 06/10/2020 Contacted seller: 06/12/2020 as of 06/14/2020 still waiting to hear back
customer_reviews.author: Kit kat

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, easy to stow, good design
customer_reviews.text: My two teen-age granddaughters found these twin-sized rollaway beds to be comfortable and much better than sleeping on too short sofas. I'm glad I got two of the twin size, there is more room for them and twin fitted bed sheets work well. The rollaway beds were easy to put together, with help from my spouse, and they fold up to a fairly compact size. I folded them up myself, covered them with Milliard Universal covers, and they are nicely stowed in a corner of the enclosed sunroom where they will be used. I am very happy with this product, and expect many years of use because they are well designed, well built and durable.
customer_reviews.author: angusmacscottie

customer_reviews.title: Awful! Do not buy! No customer support!
customer_reviews.text: This cot has been awful!! I've contacted customer support and recieved no response. This bed supposedly has a 10 year warranty so I'd like a refund for my purchase. We've only had it for about a month and a half. It's been slept on a handful of times. The springs started popping off after the first time it was slept on. We were able to fix the springs and it was slept on a few more times before multiple springs had popped and they are no longer fixable. This was an expensive piece of junk! Do not order this cot!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Jean

customer_reviews.title: Twin XL longer length, comfort and fold away convenience all in one!!
customer_reviews.text: Great roll-a-way bed and the Twin XL size was perfect for all the out of town guests we had for the holidays. SO easy to assemble and folding back up was a breeze. Everyone who used it said it was a great temporary mattress and they were very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Roth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent roll away bed for company or short term use.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Moore

customer_reviews.title: TOOLS ARE REQUIRED!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bed arrived without a number of the holes drilled for the bolts. I had to use my electric drill to drill out the holes that were supposed to be there from the factory. I purchased Zinus Traveler Premier Folding Twin Guest Beds in the past and they were excellent. These, on the other hand, are poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K

customer_reviews.title: Black metal coating flakes everywhere
customer_reviews.text: We got this bed as a sleepover rollaway for our kiddo's friends. The mattress seems pretty comfy, and the rolling part is great. But it flakes its black shiny paint everywhere. After we assembled it, the floor was littered with the mess. It has continued to flake off when we fold and unfold it, and that's just in the first couple weeks of having it. Great idea, but for the money, I'd expect better quality.
customer_reviews.author: I&D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bed for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great roll away bed for company. Very comfortable memory foam mattress and it doesn't make noises when you move around. Was easy to assemble and fits nicely in a closet for storage. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Carbo

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Super Duper excited this roller away bed is the Best. In my new home with no guest room,husband tested positive for COVID-19,he is at home so therefore he has the only bedroom on Quantine. So,I have been sleeping on a very expensive leather sectional for 5 weeks. Being 5'4 and 250lbs sleeping on a leather couch is not idea. This roll a away bed is so comfortable, sturdy, & convenient. It does sit low,it makes me stretch before & after laying down.Great Buy after weeks of research. Worth the money the house have a guest bed. Yeah..Sooo Happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Sturdy Build, Comfortable Sleep
customer_reviews.text: Last year, I bought a competitor brand foldaway for the same price, but returned it when the frame bent simply by opening its retainer strap. THAT frame used squared tubing. THIS foldaway is built with circular tubing, which for this application is very strong. The frame is sturdy. You can comfortably sit on this bed -- the frame is very well-designed. Thick canvas supported by tension springs 6" apart surround the perimeter, providing evenly distributed support. The mattress is comfortable for its 4" thickness, and it has a rubberized bottom to minimize slip. A mattress pad improves comfort. I can recommend this foldaway with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: JeffB

customer_reviews.title: Be careful if you are heavy
customer_reviews.text: Even though the weight limit for this twin bed is 350 lbs, in reality it is likely much less. I had popped springs from sleeping on it. I am not 350 lbs nor near it, but I’m not a thin person either. The bed is also VERY low to the ground. So be careful getting in and out. May not be possible for people who are unsteady or have knee issues. The mattress is comfy. Set up was a bear with just one person, but doable with little skill. If not for the popped springs, I would have rated it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: My family decided the holidays were going to be at my house this year so we immediately began searching for comfortable beds to keep our guests. We had quite a few elderly guests coming and also wanted to make sure they were as comfortable as we could make them and still be able to put the beds away and save space so we ended up buying four. I think the best feature is there is no uncomfortable bar in the middle of your back. These were a big hit and I’m glad we purchased them over a few other options we had in mind. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Alora

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Even know this bed is only ment to be temparley sleeped in, it's really a piece of garbage!! Box was turn up when delivered. The bed doesn't stay open and also has zero support in the middle. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with this product. I originally purchased this for my mother in law back in December. Once she arrived she chose to sleep on the couch so it was never used. Almost two months later I need to use it bc I painted my bedroom and don’t want to sleep in there with my newborn. The bed is awful. As soon as I laid down two of the metal pieces that support the mattress snapped off the frame. I’m only 5”3 weighing at 145 no reason why it should’ve snapped like that. Every movement is also accompanied by so much noise. I’m so upset. What a waste of money!! Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.author: M. Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Give Your Guests A Comfotable Night's Rest
customer_reviews.text: It's a sturdy and comfortable bed and worth the price. It is easy to assemble once you find the directions hidden within the fold of the mattress. The assembly didn't take long and is just a few bars and the 4 roller wheels. The cover on the foam has a zipper and so it can be removed to be washed. Your tall guests will appreciate that it comes in extra long. I do recommend this bed.
customer_reviews.author: barame

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I’m 70 with arthritic hands, I put it together with no problem, just don’t tighten down the nuts and bolts until it’s ALL put together, that’s how the bed Aligned easily. I slept on it to try it out the mattress was comfortable but I did purchase a mattress topper sold on amazon for it now it’s like sleeping on a cloud! I love Amazon great delivery of a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Rmc7

customer_reviews.title: Great for chronic pain sufferer
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to sleep on during a two-week stay with my daughter, who has an efficiency apartment. I am a chronic pain sufferer, so you can imagine how essential it is to have a comfortable bed with no pressure points. This little cot is a gem! I'm petite so it was plenty big enough and holds at least 225 lbs. Even my tall son-in-law tried it out. I left it there for my next visit!
customer_reviews.author: Medieval momma

customer_reviews.title: They should warn you about assembly and no instructions!!
customer_reviews.text: Really really annoyed I researched this and bought it even though it’s more expensive but it seemed the most convenient -it arrived with no instructions in the box-and a box of wheels and parts!! No phone number only a “chat” service for customer service and they have not answered and my guests arrive tomorrow! I have no idea how to sssemble this thing
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Decent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Was very upset about my first purchase of this cot. It came defective and Lucid and Amazon were not terribly helpful in giving me assistance in returning it. Finally, I got it to the UPS store to return it and ordered a new one. It is comfortable and dimensions are as described. Only issue I have is it's not as sturdy as I would've expected. I'm scared one side will flip up randomly as it did when I first laid onto it. And yes, I put it together correctly. Probably won't recommend, but it will do for a guest bed.
customer_reviews.author: Holly B

customer_reviews.title: Good guest bed.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for when my pops comes to town. Only had one week of use, he thought it was too low to the ground. Got an air mattress, which he put under the Lucid Mattress. So he liked the mattress, he has knee issues so didn't want to struggle out of bed. Construction for me was easy. It's built smartly. Get the cover that's made for it. Stores easy on a half walk in closet I have. Would recommend. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: I hate Sunlight

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rollaway
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice rollaway. The 4 inch matters is fairly good for children or adults under 200 pounds. Anything over that I think you'd be a bit uncomfortable. We cut the end off one end of the box and it slides right over the folded bed for storage and allows it to still roll on its casters. The 4 stars only because of the price. There are better value's out there you just have to look for them. There customer service is very good. Our bed arrived missing the end caps. We got them within 3 days by priority mail.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Rupp

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.  Not the most comfortable bed and is now coming apart.
customer_reviews.text: First of, I'm about 5'8ish and weigh 150 pounds. The mattress is somewhat thin and the bottom is really just nylon stretched out by coiled springs. This makes the mattress sags in the middle even with my fairly light frame. Also, the wingnuts always comes loose. Last and one of the most annoying things is that it creeks, even after tightening everything. This was one of the few purchases I regretted. -- Update One of the coils just popped off and the hole where it was hooked through is now busted so I need to make a new hole to put it back together.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this as accommodations for visiting guests because I do not have a second bedroom. When folded up, this is quite a compact package that will fit well in a garage, storage unit, or a large closet. I was quite worried about comfort, but my recent visitor was very happy - she said it was a lot better than my old sofa bed. There is absolutely no smell to the mattress, which I was happy about since foam can sometimes be stinky at first, and the construction feels very solid.
customer_reviews.author: SlyCaptainFlint

customer_reviews.title: good quality frame
customer_reviews.text: good quality frame, nice welds, easy to put together, tabs that hold longer brackets a little off, not square with the frame but worked good. wheels locked ok but on tile floor the bed still moved around, The box that it was shipped in was battered up pretty bad and a lot of tape all over the place, like it fell open and the shipper had to re tape it. all and very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Kent Biser

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy
customer_reviews.text: The set up was easy. It did have some screws that were an odd shape but after a little look see I got it together that was the only reason I gave it 4 stars. My twin sheets fit the cot very well. We had no issue with an odor it came 2 days before we needed it and opened the box first thing.
customer_reviews.author: James Anspaugh

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so could sleep in the room with my husband while he was sick. I was not expecting much so was very happy that this was really so easy to put together and comfortable. Not really much to put together wheels and 4 supports all of which just screw on. Also the mattress is comfortable. It is firm but not hard. Also the size was perfect for the small area I have. I am buying a cover and may even buy another one to keep on hand for the grandchildren. Glad I found this.
customer_reviews.author: SPD

customer_reviews.title: Easy and comfy, so far
customer_reviews.text: Our grandsons are ready to graduate to "real" guest beds for their visits, and I picked the LUCID cot based on the Amazon reviews. Nobody's slept on them yet, but I can weigh in on setup and apparent comfort. Setup was fast and easy. The instructions were clear, all parts were present, and no tools were needed. Took maybe ten minutes for the first bed and five for the second. In terms of comfort, I did a test lie-down and the cots felt good. The acid test will be the next family visit, next month. I will edit this review if there are any complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Let the Looks Deceive You
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the cot-size version of this product when we had visitors, and were frankly appalled at how light and thin the mattress was when it arrived. Looks like something you'd find in a first-aid tent. To save face, we gave up our bed and my wife (who is 59) ended up on the cot. She said it was extremely comfortable, better even than our own fairly expensive bed. How this works I don't know, but you won't go wrong having a couple of these things stored away for when your kid brings home friends from college or other emergency.
customer_reviews.author: John Moran

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for Grandkid Visits
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for when our young grandkids come to visit in the summer. It worked much better than our previous air mattress for their 2-3 week stays. I loved that I could lay on the bed next to them to read stories before bedtime. I couldn't do that on the air mattress very easily! It turned our office room into a nice guest room! I did buy a mattress topper to make it a bit more cushy since the mattress was a little on the hard side. This bed was easy to put together and stores nicely in our extra closet.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda T.

customer_reviews.title: Frame is no good.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it folds up and that the fame is on wheels. Really makes it easy to store it away. I am very disappointed in the quality though. I think it is way over priced for what it is. The quality is just not there. 5th time it was used for an average sized guest the entire frame collapsed bending the side bars. I took the frame apart and straightened them back out. But due to the stress of bending the metal. It just keeps collapsing again. Now I’m stuck with a broken frame.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Support in the center a little lacking
customer_reviews.text: Because this is a heavy duty fabric held up on springs I found that when laying down it will sag a bit in the middle. We ended up returning this. The mattress itself was pretty comfy though. If we decide to repurchase this still of cot, we'll get the one with metal support grids/slats instead to avoid the sinking in the middle. I'd imagine this is far more comfortable than sleeping on an air bed for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: One of the two beds purchased was missing one of ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the two beds purchased was missing one of the brace bars and we have been unable to find parts so we can use the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Trena Brand

customer_reviews.title: Good guest bed for small space
customer_reviews.text: We've had this product a couple weeks and are satisfied. We've had 3 different people enjoy sleeping on the bed. It was pretty quick to put together and folds easily. We got the twin size and bought twin size sheets and they are a little big, but it doesn't really matter too much.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Decent bed for temporary use
customer_reviews.text: This bed is fairly comfortable for its size and it folds out of the way pretty easy. The negative is that the frame is not super tough. If you have a teenager who doesn't treat things gently, you might have your frame break like mine did. The supporting bolts tore through the tubing making the frame not lay straight. I think if you treat it gently it would be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Keith D

customer_reviews.title: The screws dont even fit
customer_reviews.text: Received bed today. One of the screws is incorrectly shaped which causes the bed is be lopsided. The screws do not properly fit into the two bolts. Also im unable to fold bed and put away. Very disappointed. Wish I could take it back but cant fit it back in the box it came in to return it. Paid too much for this not to be what it should be. Wish I could do something about it. ***They actually sent me another bed and this one was perfect!!! No screw issues. I threw everything back in the box and mailed it back to them. Thank goodness for strong tape lol Changing from 1 star to 4
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Shay

customer_reviews.title: Good with a mod
customer_reviews.text: I been using this for 3 months daily. The only way this is comfortable is if you cut a 4x8 sheet of wood to fit in the rectangular shape of the bedframe then put the mattress on top. Otherwise the existing cloth material that holds the mattress up will sag. That caused me backpain. The mattress on top of a flat wood surface is comfortable and durable. I weigh 183lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Orion

customer_reviews.title: I can't put it together
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could review this bed based on it's comfort, but I can't even put it together. I'm pretty clever that way, what with all of the Ikea furniture experience I've gained over the years. The screw holes don't line up well enough to assemble the support bars so it's stored in the closet for the next time I need to try using it. The drilled holes are off by quite a bit so I'm not sure that having a second pair of hands to help will solve this problem.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lovin

customer_reviews.title: Metal Frame Collapsed Within 2 Yrs of Purchase
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this bed in June 2017 for use nightly by an overnight health care aide of average size and weight. The metal frame supports recently sheared off and the bed collapsed. I do not recommend this bed for regular or extended use.
customer_reviews.author: Nina G.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable cot
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable for a cot! I like that there's no cross-bar in the middle of the cot, and the memory foam mattress is great. You'll want to clear the smell out of the mattress by taking it out of the package, walking across it several times to push all of the air out, and leaving it to air out for a couple of days before you try to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for teens
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable for teens. Bought two for commercial purposes one broke immediately and over a year later the other is still in use. For the money a good extra bed alternative.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Hesnan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy the reboxed discount.
customer_reviews.text: Skip the reboxed Amazon discount crap and buy the actual new one. First one came from Amazon missing the mattress and frame supports. Thought I was saving $20. Returned and reordered a new one. Everything came perfect and the bed is super comfortable and sturdy, even with my 300lb butt on it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good rollaway bed option!
customer_reviews.text: This bed had worked wonderfully for me when I have company!! It is compact and stores easily in my walk-in, takes regular twin-sized sheets, and is very comfortable!! I use the bed myself when I have company and sleep well in it; I am 5’2 and average weight, so cannot speak to how comfortable it would be for someone talker or heavier than myself. There have been no issues with mattress odor and set-up has been quite easy. My only issue thus far is that during its second or third use, it was quite squeaky when I moved/rolled/repositioned, but this seems to have faded with continued use.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherS

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable to sleep on!♥️
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for overnight guests and ended up sleeping on it for 3 nights straight. No back aches, headaches or discomfort after sleeping on this comfy roll out. Single, twin sheets work great with the mattress. When laying down no bar in the middle like most roll outs. Definitely would purchase again no doubt!♥️♥️
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Best investment ever!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for guests coming to visit because of the high ratings and noted guarantee it was comfortable. Thought it was pricey but took the chance. I'm so glad I did! The man sleeping on it was pretty large and said he slept well on it. Light assembly of the frame needed. Did it myself without my husband's help. No tools needed. full size, 4 inch, memory foam mattress. Doesn't quite fill a full size fitted sheet but did the job. A recommended buy from me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for temporary situation
customer_reviews.text: If someone was staying more than a 3 or 4 days this might not be ideal. For a short term stay for an average person this is an okay feeling bed. I got the thinner mattress due to cost constraints. Someone over 200 lbs I don't think its going to be super comfortable for them. But I could be wrong. Ive had one person stay on it two nights they said it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gina CentralTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rollaway bed
customer_reviews.text: I am giving five stars to this product, because it is very easy to assemble, it only took a few minutes, and the most important thing is that it is very confortable. I bought this bed because I had a house full of guests, and I needed an extra bed, my guest was impressed by how confortable it was. I have bought in the past other foldable beds but they were horrible, the mattress was too thin and you could feel the bars, no problems with this one!
customer_reviews.author: christine finck

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fold up
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a spare bed. Definitely comfortable enough for a child. Putting it together was a pain because a lot of the parts didn't fit well together, but a little brute force and it works. My only real complaint is that the wheels are some of the most laughably bad I've ever seen on any product ever. As a gag, when I have people over I ask them to try to push the folded up bed in a straight line and so far not a single person, even with considerable effort, has been able to.
customer_reviews.author: j.sapsford

customer_reviews.title: Used product
customer_reviews.text: Bed frame had scratches , bed springs are very sharp and can hurt anyone handling the bed if they aren’t very careful. Tools that came with product were already opened which is a big indication that it’s a used product. I will be returning this bed to seller.
customer_reviews.author: JamRock

customer_reviews.title: and he said the bed was comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use it, but a solid gent - about 6' 3" 240lbs - used this bed on a duck hunting trip to Arkansas. The rented house was furnished, but the home did not have enough beds to accomodate the guests. His feet were off the end, but we knew that would be the case when making the purchase. It beat a sleeping bag on the floor, and he said the bed was comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worst purchase ever!!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were pretty good so thought I would give it a try as wanted an XL Twin and there weren't many other choices. All that had to be assembled was the wheels and 2 side braces but not one bolt was right for the holes and none of the braces lined up either. It would have required a lot of re-drilling and that was not going to work for me. Very disappointed!! Thank goodness I had the box so could return (and by the way, the box is so flimsy it was totally ripped up when bed arrived and had to use massive amounts of tape to keep it back together!)
customer_reviews.author: Linda Huml

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We have had our fold-away bed for a couple of years now and it has turned out to be a great purchase. It's easy to fold and unfold, takes less space to store it than we expected and guests say it's comfortable as all get out. It's perfect at holiday time when you always need an extra. And after two years, it's still in great shape. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sallanns

customer_reviews.title: A good buy but needs a bunky board for comfort
customer_reviews.text: Memory foam is way too soft. I slept on it before my guests arrived and quickly realized that it needed a bunky board. My handyman installed a !/2" piece of Masonite and attached it to the board for $40. Then it passed the comfort test!!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: He's my boy.
customer_reviews.text: This bed is really meant for small spaces. My son co sleeps with me and I lay it next to my bed wonderfully. He sleeps comfortably ande actually likes it. The assembly was quickly in less than 10 minutes we were done. I wish to take the rollies out because it does rolls on my wood floors. I try putting something underneath to stop it from rolling but it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable yet supportive
customer_reviews.text: Dislikes? It is low to the floor for me at 6' with 34" inseam but livable. Issue? The short welded tabs that the 4 long struts bolt to? Two were welded on crooked, so I gently bent the struts a bit. I read many of the reviews here..... The paint finish is very good, the foam mattress is divine for my 6', 230# body, this is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and mostly solidly built
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and mostly solidly built. Would have given 5 stars, but a couple of the wingnuts were damaged (stripped), so I had to secure my own, which was a minor hassle. The buckle/strap that holds the bed together when stored is almost useless. The buckle unlocks with the slightest amount of pressure. Otherwise, I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JD18960

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy for the price. The memory foam type mattress is super comfortable. Set it up as a studio couch in office. We did add a 4” foam support under it as the couch is pretty low to floor and hard to stand up from for us geriatrics. But, everyone is fighting for this cot for nap space.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with a bent frame! Unusable!
customer_reviews.text: After much research on reviews, I had finally decided on purchasing this rollaway bed. The box arrived Un damaged but once I tried to assemble the bed and open it I realize the frame was bent and welded that way. I could not fully open the bed flat on the floor...the mattress was perfect but this frame is sad. Over $200 down the drain. There is no way they did not notice this when packaging this item.
customer_reviews.author: aq17

customer_reviews.title: Fine bed, super cheap nuts/bolts
customer_reviews.text: The bed itself is fine and of good quality. Unfortunately they tried to save 10 cents by putting the cheapest bolts and wing nuts they could find. The bolts do not fit well in the holes and one of the wing nuts did not even have any threads, so I need to go find another wingnut.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Royston

customer_reviews.title: Super-comfy!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and surprisingly comfortable, so glad we bought this instead of a regular bed since we can fold this up and move it out of the way since we rarely have guests. Guests will be elated not to sleep on an air mattress or in our daughter's room. Our first guest weighed about 250 and he loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Deej

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product to have. You never know when you may have guests, or when you may need to quarantine yourself in the guest room. If you have a truck or SUV, it’s easy to transport, and could potentially be used in a hotel room if you have an added guest, sometimes hotels have their own cots, sometimes not. It’s comfortable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Enigma

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble and seems ok, but broken upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: The bed was easy enough to assemble. It does sag with my weight and i am no where near the limit. i think i will add some plywood as a bunkie board. but the main issue is that two of the springs are popped off and i am not able to connect them again. for $264 this is unacceptable. thinking i should have just bought the amazon basics foldable frame with a 10 inch mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie Tam

customer_reviews.title: Great rollaway bed♥
customer_reviews.text: Needed a rollaway at my daughters house, for grandson's graduation, due to extra relatives. I researched and sent this bed, which arrived in 2 days with prime at a great price. I am 72 years old with screws in my hip. I slept on this bed 9 days. It was super comfortable. Felt better than my mattress at home. I highly recommend this " Lucid Rollaway Folding Guest Bed with 4" memory Foam Mattress". Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: 7dazzle

customer_reviews.title: Customer support is great, product is shoddy!
customer_reviews.text: Product was delivered missing a wheel. I contacted the manufacturer and they were great. They sent me a replacement no problem. My one star rating is because the frame broke the second night I slept on it! The bolt like parts that have something to do with support broke off this morning and the bed collapsed. It’s rated for 450lbs and I have more than 100lbs under the limit so I don’t know what happened.
customer_reviews.author: Kaytie

customer_reviews.title: Need strength in hands is springs fall out
customer_reviews.text: Do like the cot/mattress combo that folds up and wheels into closet. However multiple springs that hold material to frame fell out and are impossible for me to put back (grandmother). Presume manufacturer had jig to pull material taut for spring to be attached.
customer_reviews.author: L Roth

customer_reviews.title: Great bed, don't hesitate!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Lucid rollaway I have purchased! We purchased one for the frequent overnighters we have, both adults and teens. All have said that this bed is very comfortable. It stores easy and doesn't take up a lot of space. I put another in my Amazon cart and when I saw the price had gone down $20 I purchased another!!!
customer_reviews.author: DLVB

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable mattress. Folds up nice and thin. Slightly wider than the others I was looking at so more comfortable for guests. Smooth rolling wheels. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Well made and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy,easy to put the wheels on. The mattress is of great quality made of memory foam and the cover for it zips right off so you can wash it! It washes beautifully. I hung it to air dry. Good quality and no shrinkage. No sharp edges or annoying springs.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of One.

customer_reviews.title: Lucid cot
customer_reviews.text: Good fold up bed , strong and steady and comfortable the only problem was that the box was in real bad shape I think that it should have been in a normal shipping box not just the manufacturers box which is not to good for shipping, but would be fine for in store sales.
customer_reviews.author: Eric K.

customer_reviews.title: Very good bed well made mattress is good
customer_reviews.text: Great bed very well made heavy sturdy sleeps good I have 4 friends that tried it out they all want one very please
customer_reviews.author: connie duering

customer_reviews.title: Best Sleep
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cot because I need to get some sleep whenever my husband is snoring very loudly. Used it for the first time last night! It's very comfortable. I was able to get some very restful sleep. Definitely worth the money. Much better than inflatable beds.
customer_reviews.author: Lourdes

customer_reviews.title: Ok overall.
customer_reviews.text: Ok overall. Kind of sags in the middle though. Not sure I'd be very comfortable on it, but the grandkids seem to like it. Shipping container arrived so damaged I was worried initially, but there were only some minor scratches inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Box came broken up by delivery company. Everything was still intact. By far the simplest thing to put together. When my daughter comes home from college I needed something better to sleep on. I like super soft mattress, this is more firm to medium. But for the price and ease of putting together this is a great purchase. So far holding together will
customer_reviews.author: mary sossaman

customer_reviews.title: Quality yet to be determined !
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that two of the springs that attach to the frame were not hooked on. I hope this isn’t isn’t a sign of things to come. I also wish the mattress was a little thicker! I will not be returning it and crossing my fingers that it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Big daddy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the holes don’t line up properly and the parts don’t fit. In my case, the wheel casters don’t even fit all the way through so install the support bars. Unfortunately this item is rendered useless for me because without the wheels installed the middle section has no support. It’s disappointing that something at this price point has such awful QC issues for something as basic as drilling holes.
customer_reviews.author: Krystyna Roman

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It claims to support up to 350lbs; but that was a lie. I'm only 220lbs and the frame is falling apart. Springs have stretched and some have popped off. I had to put the mattress (the only good part of the bed) on the floor just to have somewhere to sleep last night. Never in my life have I ever been ripped off so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service and product.
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit tight to get the screws to line up. The bed had a defective part that broke the first time we used it. I contacted the seller and they were so nice and speedy to deal with the issue and get us a replacement. I would buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Reasonably comfortable, especially for a portable bed. Sits low to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Abc Xyz

product_meta.title: LUCID Rollaway Folding Guest Bed with 4 Inch Memory Foam Mattress - Rolling Cot - Easy Storage - Cot
product_meta.description: Size:CotNeed to accommodate an extra guest? The LUCID Rollaway Bed with Memory Foam Mattress is a perfect and comfortable solution. Not only does it fold up for easy storage, but the 4 inch memory foam mattress gives your guest exceptional comfort for a good night's rest. The rayon from bamboo cover is even ideal for sensitive skin. The heavy duty steel frame offers 11 inches of clearance so your guest can easily stow luggage below. The supporting deck absorbs impact, successfully avoiding that "bouncy" feeling. Our dual locking wheels keep the frame in place and safe all through the night. Built for strength and durability, the steel frame also features a spring supported mattress deck. The rollaway is quick and easy to assemble. A cot sized rollaway bed requires specialty cot sized sheets, which are hard to find in your local department store. Pair this cot sized rollaway bed purchase with proper fitting sheets before you checkout.
feature_bullets: Roll a way guest mattress is soft and ultra supportive, with a medium feel mattress featuring 1 inch of memory foam and 3 inches of support foam
Quickly pull out the bed for guests or children, then fold and roll away for super easy storage
With its easy assembly, locking wheels for safety, and certipur us certified memory foam with no harmful odors, this bed is safe for children
Spring supported deck offers support more comfortably than wood slat and wire mesh support alternatives, total weight capacity 350 pounds
Heavy duty bed frame comes with an impressive 10 year warranty no tools needed available sizes: cot, twin and twin xl; cot measures 31 x 73 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,077 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
